snippet: The talks, aimed at reaching a political settlement, are seen as a last chance to end fighting that has plunged the country into deepening insecurity and economic chaos.
abstract: United Nations is set to begin new round of peace talks aimed at curbing violence and unrest in Libya; many fear that country is close to complete chaos as influence of Muslim extremists grows.
lead_paragraph: The talks, aimed at reaching a political settlement, are seen as a last chance to end fighting that has plunged the country into deepening insecurity and economic chaos.

headline.main: Fearing ‘Total Chaos’ in Libya, U.N. Plans New Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Fearing ‘Total Chaos’ in Libya, U.N. Plans New Peace Talks
